actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on December 15, 2023.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 20 U.S.C. 4412, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Board of Trustees of the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development: Mr. Cole and Ms. Leger Fernandez.

actions-list.header: United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 1928a, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly: Mr. Norcross.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of Gallaudet University
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 20 U.S.C. 4303, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Board of Trustees of Gallaudet University: Mr. Bucshon and Ms. McCollum.

Pursuant to section 2406(b)(3) of Public Law 116-9, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Adams Memorial Commission: Mr. Griffith, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Lynch and Mr. Connolly.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of the Open World Leadership Center
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 313 of the Legislative Branch Appropriations Act, 2001 (2 U.S.C. 1151), as amended by section 1601 of Pub L. 111-68, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Board of Trustees of the Open World Leadership Center: Mr. Bacon.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Thursday, December 14, 2023, through Monday, January 8, 2024, as a "district work period."

Pursuant to the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Foundation authorizing statute (20 U.S.C. 4703), the Majority Leader appointed the following member of the House to the Board of Trustees: Mr. Grothman.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 407
actions-list.actionItem: 9 (Roll no. 724).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2365 â€” "To direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services to carry out a national project to prevent and cure Parkinson's, to be known as the National Parkinson's Project, and for other purposes."
Motions to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the conference report Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 310

actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on agreeing to the conference report to accompany H.R. 2670 and on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 2365, as amended.

actions-list.header: On motion to adjourn Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 23

actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Roy moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House proceeded with 40 minutes of debate on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the conference report accompanying H.R. 2670.
Mr. Rogers (AL) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the conference report, H. Rept. 118-301.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Collins to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable David G. Valadao to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
